definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Cloaked before me, right within my immediate reach was a beautiful life worth living.
sentences.chinese: 被遮盖住的是我触手可及的值得去生活的美丽人生。

sentences.english: Master peer, You the most distance in my fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 朱梓骁，你在我那触手可及的最远处。

sentences.english: Commercial space travel is now almost within reach of ordinary citizens.
sentences.chinese: 商业空间飞行现已几乎触手可及。

sentences.english: Now the Libya that you deserve is within your reach.
sentences.chinese: 现在，你们所希望拥有的利比亚已经触手可及。

sentences.english: Victory appeared to be virtually guaranteed, but this time, Usain Bolt messed up on the big stage.
sentences.chinese: 胜利似乎已经触手可及，但是这次他犯了重大的错误。

sentences.english: Now those things are within reach and they are grabbing them.
sentences.chinese: 现在这些东西触手可及，她们正在尽力得到它们。

sentences.english: A silver moon, almost close enough to touch.
sentences.chinese: 而那一轮银月却仿佛触手可及。

sentences.english: She is one of the famous leading actresses in Hollywood. Fame and fortune is near at hand.
sentences.chinese: 她是好莱坞的一线女星，名和利触手可及。

definition: unattainable/far-fetched/out of reach/exceedingly remote or distant
in sight but unattainable (idiom)/inaccessible/also written 可望而不可及[ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2]
pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: too high to reach (idiom); eminent and unapproachable

pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
distantly remote/also written 邈遠|邈远[miao3 yuan3]
variant of 彷彿|仿佛[fang3 fu2]
